direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods deal with attribute presence and retrieval, but one returns a boolean and the other returns the attribute value.
Both methods handle attribute retrieval, but 'attr' returns the first matching attribute value while 'eachAttr' returns a list of all matching attribute values.
Both methods deal with attributes, but 'attr(String)' retrieves an attribute value while 'attr(String, String)' sets an attribute value.
Both methods interact with attributes, but 'attr' retrieves the attribute value while 'removeAttr' removes the attribute.
Both methods involve querying elements, but 'attr' retrieves attribute values while 'select' filters elements based on a query.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing elements with a collection is similar to setting up the state for attribute retrieval.
Checking for attribute presence before retrieving it ensures the attribute exists.
Verifying attribute presence can help in asserting the correct behavior of the 'attr' method.
